intro: Navarretia subnuda, commonly known as the naked navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has slender, branched stems and linear leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Navarretia subnuda is a short-lived perennial that produces seeds in early summer, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
